blackjackplayground

Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • blackjackplayground.Hand

  • public class Hand
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a single hand in the game of blackjack.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Hand(java.lang.String owner)
      Creates a new Hand object and specifies the owner

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBet(int b)
      Adds given amount to the amount bet in the hand.
      void addCard(Card c)
      Adds a given card to the hand.
      boolean blackJack()
      Checks if the hand holds a Blackjack (21 value with first two cards, ACE and 10 or J or Q or K)
      int getAcedValue()
      Returns the value of the hand when Ace is considered 11 If value goes over 21, returns 0;
      int getBet()
      Returns the amount bet to the hand
      Card getCard(int index)
      Returns the card dealt to given index
      java.lang.String getOwner()
      Owner set to the hand
      int getSize()
      Returns the size of the hand for testing.
      int getValue()
      Returns the value of the hand, Aces are considered 1
      boolean hasAce()
      Returns true if the hand holds Ace
      boolean isSplittable()
      In BlackJack, you can split a hand that has pairs to two hands that are both dealt one new card Method checks that the owner of the Hand is player and it has not been split before (no re-splitting allowed) and the both of the hands cards have the same value
      Hand split()
      Creates a new hand using one card from the orginal hand.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hand

        public Hand(java.lang.String owner)
        Creates a new Hand object and specifies the owner
        Parameters:
        owner - owner of the hand

    • Method Detail

      • addCard

        public void addCard(Card c)
        Adds a given card to the hand. If card is null, returns without doing anything.
        Parameters:
        c - card dealt to hand

      • blackJack

        public boolean blackJack()
        Checks if the hand holds a Blackjack (21 value with first two cards, ACE and 10 or J or Q or K)
        Returns:
        true if the hand holds blackjack

      • isSplittable

        public boolean isSplittable()
        In BlackJack, you can split a hand that has pairs to two hands that are both dealt one new card Method checks that the owner of the Hand is player and it has not been split before (no re-splitting allowed) and the both of the hands cards have the same value
        Returns:
        true if the hand has pair with 2 first cards.

      • split

        public Hand split()
        Creates a new hand using one card from the orginal hand. If Hand is not splittable, returns null
        Returns:
        Split hand

      • getAcedValue

        public int getAcedValue()
        Returns the value of the hand when Ace is considered 11 If value goes over 21, returns 0;
        Returns:
        Value of the hand with Ace considered 11

      • addBet

        public void addBet(int b)
        Adds given amount to the amount bet in the hand. If less than 10, add 10
        Parameters:
        b - given bet

      • getCard

        public Card getCard(int index)
        Returns the card dealt to given index
        Parameters:
        index - The index of Card wanted
        Returns:
        Card in the given index

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        Returns the value of the hand, Aces are considered 1
        Returns:
        Value of the hand.

      • getOwner

        public java.lang.String getOwner()
        Owner set to the hand
        Returns:
        owner

      • hasAce

        public boolean hasAce()
        Returns true if the hand holds Ace
        Returns:
        true if the hand holds Ace

      • getBet

        public int getBet()
        Returns the amount bet to the hand
        Returns:
        amount bet to the hand

        public int getSize()
        Returns the size of the hand for testing.
        Returns:
